questions.question: If the traffic hadn't been so bad, what would have happened regarding their flight?
options: They would have caught their flight.
questions.answer: They would have caught their flight.

questions.question: If she hadn't been sick, what could she have done last night?
options: She could go to the concert.
She could have gone to the concert.
She would go to the concert.
She had gone to the concert.
questions.answer: She could have gone to the concert.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the third conditional to talk about a different job choice?
options: If he took the other job, he would have earned more.
If he had taken the other job, he would earned more.
If he had taken the other job, he would have earned more.
If he would have taken the other job, he earned more.
questions.answer: If he had taken the other job, he would have earned more.

questions.question: How would someone express regret about losing a winning lottery ticket using the third conditional?
options: If I hadn't lost the ticket, I would be rich now.
If I didn't lose the ticket, I would have been rich.
If I hadn't lost the ticket, I would have become rich.
If I not lost the ticket, I would become rich.
questions.answer: If I hadn't lost the ticket, I would have become rich.
